alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Mendocino Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 30 at 10:20PM PST until January 31 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM PST WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following areas, Northeastern Mendocino Interior and Southern Trinity. * WHEN...From 7 AM PST Wednesday through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...There will be an increased risk of rock and land slides along roadways. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Three to six inches of rain is expected very early Wednesday through Wednesday night. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
